Welcome to Brainbox: A collaborative effort of the International Brain Lab¶

What is Brainbox?¶

Brainbox is a suite of simple tools for analyzing spike-sorted electrophysiological data.

With brainbox we aim to provide a useful set of functions for analyzing data that take simple inputs (lists, arrays, etc.) and provide simple outputs of similar form. Brainbox includes tools for analyzing single units and populations of neurons, as well as many useful plotting functions.

Brainbox is a work in progress. If you would like to contribute, please visit our GitHub page!

Table of Contents¶

  • Overview of Brainbox

Brainbox API reference¶

  • brainbox.behavior: Functions for dealing with behavioral data
  • brainbox.io: Functions for data I/O through Brainbox
  • brainbox.metrics: Functions for assesing spike unit quality
  • brainbox.plot: Plotting utilities for single units and populations
  • brainbox.population: Population activity analyses
  • brainbox.processing: Functions for transforming data
  • brainbox.quality: General quality control metrics for data
  • brainbox.simulation: Tools for simulating data
  • brainbox.singlecell: Tools for examining single cell activity
